meanings.sent1: She was flacking her new book to all her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company is flacking their latest product through social media.
meanings.sent3: The magician flacked his disappearing act, but no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: The politician was flacking his policies like a salesman selling a miracle cure.
meanings.sent5: The teacher flacked the upcoming test as the most important event of the year.

meanings.definition: The act of promoting or publicizing something
meanings.sent1: The flacking of the event brought in a large crowd.
meanings.sent2: His job involves a lot of flacking for different products.
meanings.sent3: The flacking of the school play made it seem like a Hollywood premiere.
meanings.sent4: The flacking of the charity event was like a beacon calling for help.
meanings.sent5: The flacking of the new movie made everyone excited to see it.
